item.title: Dynamically-generated Cakefile Tasks
item.description:
Cake is a task-runner for CoffeeScript.

======= <![CDATA[Jesse Clark’s BlogJournals of the Expeditionhttp://jessejohnclark.commetalsmith-feedMon, 16 May 2016 03:33:09 GMTJesse Clark Dynamically-generated Cakefile Tasks<p><a href="http://coffeescript.org/documentation/docs/cake.html">Cake</a> is a task-runner for <a href="http://coffeescript.org/">CoffeeScript</a>.</p> >>>>>>> ba2b6d2c22f36a8bd977b71dcf0de82f515a91b8 <p>It can be useful to invoke external scripts from <code>cake</code>, if they are written in another language or simply don't fit in the <code>Cakefile</code>. Suppose we have a <code>scripts</code> directory populated with various text-based executables, and we want to automatically define a <code>cake</code> task for each of those scripts, with an appropriate description, like so:</p> <pre><code><span class="hljs-variable">$ </span>ls scripts build.py clean.sh <span class="hljs-variable">$ </span>cake cake build <span class="hljs-comment"># build the project</span> cake clean <span class="hljs-comment"># remove built files</span> <span class="hljs-variable">$ </span>cake build --help build.<span class="hljs-symbol">py:</span> usage info...</code></pre> <p>We can do this in the <code>Cakefile</code> by reading each script and extracting its first comment, then defining a task with that comment as its description:</p> <pre><code class="hljs coffeescript"><span class="hljs-comment"># Define tasks for any scripts in the `scripts` directory</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> basename <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> fs.readdirSync(<span class="hljs-string">'./scripts'</span>) <span class="hljs-keyword">then</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">do</span> (basename)-> <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> basename[<span class="hljs-number">0</span>] <span class="hljs-keyword">is</span> <span class="hljs-string">'.'</span> filename = <span class="hljs-string">"./scripts/<span class="hljs-subst">#{basename}</span>"</span> contents = fs.readFileSync(filename, <span class="hljs-string">'utf8'</span>) title = basename.replace(<span class="hljs-regexp">/\..*?$/</span>, <span class="hljs-string">''</span>) <span class="hljs-comment"># use the first block comment in the file as its description</span> description = <span class="hljs-string">''</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> line, i <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> contents.split(<span class="hljs-regexp">/[\r\n]+/</span>) <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> line.match(<span class="hljs-regexp">/^#!/</span>) <span class="hljs-keyword">then</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">continue</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> line.match(<span class="hljs-regexp">/-\*- mode/</span>) <span class="hljs-keyword">then</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">continue</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> line.match(<span class="hljs-regexp">/^\s*(#|\/\/|$)/</span>) description += line.replace(<span class="hljs-regexp">/^\s*(#|\/\/)\s*/</span>, <span class="hljs-string">' '</span>).trim() <span class="hljs-keyword">continue</span> <span class="hljs-comment"># stop reading when we encounter non-comment text</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">break</span> task(title, description, <span class="hljs-function">-></span> <span class="hljs-comment"># pass command-line arguments directly in to the script</span> index = process.argv.indexOf(title) args = process.argv.slice(index+<span class="hljs-number">1</span>) child_process.spawn(filename, args, { <span class="hljs-attribute">stdio</span>: <span class="hljs-string">'inherit'</span> <span class="hljs-attribute">env</span>: env }).<span class="hljs-literal">on</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'exit'</span>, <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-params">(code, signal)</span>-></span> process.exit(code) ) <span class="hljs-comment"># prevent `cake` from invoking further tasks based on those arguments</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">global</span>.invoke = (<span class="hljs-function">-></span>) )</code></pre>http://jessejohnclark.com/posts/dynamically-generated-cakefile-taskshttp://jessejohnclark.com/posts/dynamically-generated-cakefile-tasksJesse ClarkMon, 19 Jan 2015 00:00:00 GMT Conditional Live-Reload with Metalsmith CLI<p><a href="http://www.metalsmith.io/">Metalsmith</a> is a popular static site generator.</p> <p>The <code>metalsmith</code> command-line interface allows a build process to be defined by a single JSON file. If you want to vary the build process in different situations, you need to write a script that duplicates much of the logic of the CLI. It's possible to avoid duplication by requiring the CLI binary from another script. This gives us an opportunity to modify the config with conditional or non-serializable data:</p> <pre><code><span class="hljs-keyword">var</span> config = require(<span class="hljs-string">'./metalsmith.json'</span>); <span class="hljs-comment">// provide a formatting function for use in templates</span> config.metadata.formatDate = function(date, format) { <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-title">require</span><span class="hljs-params">(<span class="hljs-string">"moment"</span>)</span><span class="hljs-params">(date)</span>.<span class="hljs-title">format</span><span class="hljs-params">(format || <span class="hljs-string">"MMMM Do, YYYY"</span>)</span></span>; } <span class="hljs-comment">// only enable live-reloading when requested</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> (process.env.AUTO_RELOAD) { config.plugins[<span class="hljs-string">'metalsmith-watch'</span>] = { livereload: <span class="hljs-number">35729</span> }; config.metadata.customHTML = <span class="hljs-string">'<script src="http://localhost:35729/livereload.js?snipver=1"></script>'</span>); } <span class="hljs-comment">// run the standard CLI</span> require(<span class="hljs-string">'metalsmith/bin/metalsmith'</span>);</code></pre> <p>This lets us use the same general config for both batch processing and live-reloading, which would otherwise be incompatible.</p> <pre><code><span class="hljs-keyword">node</span> build.js <span class="hljs-comment"># terminates after building</span> <span class="hljs-constant">A</span>UTO_RELOAD=<span class="hljs-number">1</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">node</span> build.js <span class="hljs-comment"># keeps running until killed</span></code></pre>http://jessejohnclark.com/posts/conditional-live-reload-with-metalsmith-clihttp://jessejohnclark.com/posts/conditional-live-reload-with-metalsmith-cliJesse ClarkTue, 18 Nov
